qas.question: In what geographic part of Somalia is Zeila located?
From whom were the early Muslims fleeing?
Along with the Shafi'i, to what sect of Islam do most Somalis belong?
What is the majority religion in Somalia?
A small minority of Somalis belong to what branch of Islam?

context: The history of Islam in Somalia is as old as the religion itself. The early persecuted Muslims fled to various places in the region, including the city of Zeila in modern-day <a0_0>northern<a0_0/> Somalia, so as to seek protection from <a1_0>the Quraysh<a1_0/>. Somalis were among the first populations on the continent to embrace Islam. With very few exceptions, Somalis are entirely Muslims, the majority belonging to the <a2_0>Sunni<a2_0/> branch of <a3_0>Islam<a3_0/> and the Shafi`i school of Islamic jurisprudence, although a few are also adherents of the <a4_0>Shia<a4_0/> Muslim denomination.
